dataIdInfo.idAbs: Represents current and historical HCAADT (Heavy Commercial Annual Average Daily Traffic) on sampled road systems in a particular given year. This information is displayed using the approximate collection site for each unique estimation.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Determine general estimates of location specific, heavy commercial annual average daily traffic (HCAADT) on the entire trunk highway system every year. More information about the Vehicle Classification Program can be found at: http://www.dot.state.mn.us/traffic/data/

LegConsts.othConsts: The AADT 1992 - 2012 document is available to the public at no charge at http://www.dot.state.mn.us/traffic/data/data-products.html. The data may also be requested through a submission of a written request to the Contact Person listed below.

report.evalMethDesc: Data have been topologically structured and verified.

report.measDesc: Data have been topologically structured and verified.
The AADT data is intended to represent the collection of all public roads in the state for which traffic data was collected.

AADT values extracted from separate storage database

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Route naming field where I=Interstate Highway, TH=Trunk Highway, CSAH=County State Aid Highway, CR=County Road, MSAS=Municipal State Aid Street
Feature geometry.
Route system field where 01=Interstate Highway, 02=US Highway, 03= State Highway, 04=County State Aid Highway, 07=County Road, 05=Municipal State Aid Street
Roadway route number

The unique identifier for the entire route within the state, using the following format: RRJJJJNNNNA where, RR = Route_System, JJJJ = Jurisdiction, defined as below based on Route_System (01, 02, 03 = 0000; 05, 10 = City Census Code; All others = XX00 where XX is XX = TIS County Code), NNNN = Route Number padded with leading zeros, and A = Alpha code on the end of particular routes or blank if none is present.
A unique number that identifies the traffic segment
Description of the location on a traffic segment where a count was taken
A unique number that identifies the site of class data collection (also known as Parent Sites)
Year of most recent heavy commercial annual average daily traffic (HCAADT).

citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Transportation/Office of Transportation Systems Management/Traffic Forecasting and Analysis Section
citeinfo.title: Heavy Commercial Annual Average Daily Traffic Count Locations, Minnesota, 1994-2012

pubinfo.publish: Minnesota Department of Transportation/Office of Transportation Systems Management/Traffic Forecasting and Analysis Section

descript.abstract: HCAADT is the theoretical estimate of the total number of heavy commercial vehicles using a specific segment of roadway (in both directions) on any given day of the year. This estimate represents the total number of heavy commercial vehicles per year divided by 365 and is developed using factors to adjust for season on sampled road systems in a particular given year. This information is displayed using the approximate collection site for each unique estimation.
descript.purpose: Determine general estimates of location specific, heavy commercial annual average daily traffic (HCAADT) on the entire trunk highway system every year. More information about the Traffic Volume and the Vehicle Classification Program can be found at: http://www.dot.state.mn.us/traffic/data/

citeinfo.title: Annual Average Daily Traffic Current Traffic Segments Annual Average Daily Traffic Count Locations Heavy Commercial Annual Average Daily Traffic Current Traffic Segments

timeperd.current: Year in which the most recent count data was collected, as well as every other year between 1994 and 2004, and annually since 2006.
